overall: When waste products are not cleared by the liver and kidneys, hyperammonemia can occur, leading to confusion and delirium. Fortunately, a healthy liver can clear these waste products via the urea cycle, which involves a series of biochemical reactions.

Citrulline + aspartate + ATP --> arginos: The third step of the urea cycle involves the addition of aspartate and ATP to citrulline to form arginosuccinate, which is catalyzed by the enzyme argininosuccinate synthetase.
